pr_title: Adding experimental build for multiple JUnit5 versions (#296)

timeline.message:
Multiversion Build for JUnit5 (#296)

* added new GitHub Action to run multiversion build

Multiversion Build for JUnit5 (#296)

* adapted build.gradle.kts to use new junitVersion property
* adding default gradle.properties

Multiversion Build for JUnit5 (#296)

* fixing version interpreted as number instead of String
by GitHub Action

Multiversion Build for JUnit5 (#296)

* ensure compatibility with future version of JUnit5 >=5.6.0

Multiversion Build for JUnit5 (#296)

* setting correct build events for the pullrequest

Multiversion Build for JUnit5 (#296)

* renaming actions to have a more concise check list

timeline.bodyText: Why 14? Default-version if Jupiter and Pioneer is 8!
timeline.author: Bukama
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,40 @@
+# This workflow will build a Java project with Gradle
+# For more information see: https://help.github.com/actions/language-and-framework-guides/building-and-testing-java-with-gradle
+
+name: Experimental JUnit5 build
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches: 'master'
+    tags-ignore:
+      - 'v**'
+      - 'releaseTrigger'
+  pull_request:
+    branches: '*'
+
+jobs:
+  build:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    continue-on-error: true
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        junit5: [ '5.0', '5.1', '5.2', '6.0', '6.1', '6.2' ]
+    name: with 5.${{ matrix.junit5 }}
+    steps:
+      - name: Check out repo
+        uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Setup java
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 14

replies.bodyText: the target version is 8 - does not mean you can not build it with newer versions, that is just a minor detail, but the latest LTS is 14 so i would go with our experimental topics with a recent version
replies.author: aepfli

replies.bodyText:
Latest LTS is 11, next will be 17 :)
14 is just current supported version until September (?) when 15 comes out :)
replies.author: Bukama

replies.bodyText: wait isnt it every third release an lts... did i miss again something?
replies.author: aepfli

replies.bodyText: my bad... i somehow had in my mind that every 3rd release is an LTS (not sure where this is coming from) - but than 11 would make more sense, in my opinion
replies.author: aepfli

replies.bodyText: I had the same misinformation in my mind for a long time too, but it's every 3rd year (= sixth release), not every 3rd release :)
replies.author: Bukama

timeline.bodyText: Please revert those changes - they have nothing to do with the topic of this PR!
timeline.author: Bukama

replies.bodyText: actually they have :D because DisplayIf was removed in 5.6.0 and due to that the build fails - i thought i will just fix this with this build
replies.author: aepfli

timeline.bodyText: This is confusing because it sounds like we're building against 5.2. Calling it junitMinorVersion and adding a comment showing how the variable is used should fix that.
timeline.author: nipafx
nipafx

@@ -0,0 +1,40 @@
+# This workflow will build a Java project with Gradle
+# For more information see: https://help.github.com/actions/language-and-framework-guides/building-and-testing-java-with-gradle
+

+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches: 'master'
+    tags-ignore:

+      - 'releaseTrigger'
+  pull_request:

+
+jobs:

+    continue-on-error: true
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        junit5: [ '5.0', '5.1', '5.2', '6.0', '6.1', '6.2' ]
